719357f-a.text:
Duane Park, on Duane Street, west of its intersection with Hudson Street. Across the Park appears the east side of Hudson Street, north from and including Thomas, to Worth Street. The Western Union Building stands to-day on this site, which in this view comprises the three R.C. Williams &
Co. Buildinga.
October 25, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
719357f-a.folder: Duane Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720467f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, north from Jay Street, showing the D.S. Marine Hospital at the N.W. corner of Jay Street, and a portion of the Mercantile Exchange Building (with gabled roof) at the N.W. corner of
Harrison Street.
October 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
720467f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Jay Street, Manhattan, NY

720470f-a.text:
Hudson Street, east side, south from and including Worth, to and including Thomas Streets, showing the lofts occupied by R.C. Williams and Co. These buildings were razed in 1928 and on their site now (1937) stands the 24-story Western Union Building. This view is as seen from
Harrison Street.
October 25, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
720470f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Worth Street, Manhattan, NY

720472f-a.text:
74-76 Hudson Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Worth Street.
October 25, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
720472f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Worth Street, Manhattan, NY

720465f-a.text:
Hudson Street, east side, south from but not including Duane Street to West Broadway, showing the Chambers Street station of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line at Chambers Street and West Broadway (where Eudson Street terminates). It is a point of confluence for Hudson, Chambers Streets and West Broadway. Across the elevated structure is seen the 6-story Cosmopolitan Hotel, at the N.E. corner of West Broadway and Chambers Street. In the background appears the Woolworth and Transportation
Buildings.
July 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720465f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Duane Street, Manhattan, NY

720466f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, from and including Duane (left), to and including Jay (right) Streets. The 5-story house, (at the extreme right) is the U.S. Marine Hospital at the N.W. corner of Jay Street. Also shown (background) is the Hudson River and the New Jersey shore.
August 20, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
Ne. ~2iG1
720466f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Duane Street, Manhattan, NY

720468f-b.text:
(1)
Hudson Street, west side, noh th from and including Jay, to and including Harrison Streets. Also shown (in foreground), is Worth Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Hudson Street. Notice the U.S. Narine Hospital No. 70, on the extreme left. Building with tower is the
Mercantile Exchange.
August 20, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view. Excavation work seen in progress at the S.E. corner of Worth Street is for the new 24-story Western Union Building.
August 20, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720468f-b.folder: Hudson Street & Jay Street, Manhattan, NY

720471f-a.text:
Hudson Street, east side, (foreground), south from Worth (left), to Thomas (right) Streets, showing excavation work in progress for the Western Union Building. Also shown is a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on West Broadway and aoross it buildings facing on the east side of the latter
Street.
Auust 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720471f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Worth Street, Manhattan, NY

723504f-a.text:
Thomas Street (left), at the S.E. corner of Hudson Street (right, where Thomas Street terminates), showing work in progress at the N.E. corner, for the Western Union Buildin8. Buildings at the right are on Hudson Street.
August 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
723504f-a.folder: Thomas Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

724823f-a.text:
1 to 11 Worth Street, (right) adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Hudson (left) Street. A1so shown is a 3Estory building with a sloped roof, No. 74 Hudson Street, directly at the'afore-mentioned corner. On the left appears a view northward on the west side of Hudson Street, from, but not including Jay, across Harrison, to Franklin Streets. In the foreground is a portion of the clearance for the present (1937) Western
Dnion Building.
August 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
724823f-a.folder: Worth Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

724824f-a.text:
Worth Street, east from Hudson Street, showing excavation work in pregress on the south side of the street for the Western Union Building. Also shown, is a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on West Broadway.
Augst 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NN 2 A733
724824f-a.folder: Worth Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720473f-a.text:
87-101 Hudson Street, West side, north from but not including Harrison, to and including Franklin Streets, showing (extreme left) a portion of the Mercantile Exchange Building. On the extreme right appears a portion of the 11-story Powell Building, at the N.W. corner
of Franklin Street.
March 27, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail of the same, showing a more comprehensive view of No. 9799, a 6-story loft building, as seen from Leonard Street.
March 27, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
720473f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Harrison Street, Manhattan, NY

720473f-b.text:
87-101 Hudson Street, West side, north from but not including Harrison, to and including Franklin Streets, showing (extreme left) a portion of the Mercantile Exchange Building. On the extreme right appears a portion of the 11-story Powell Building, at the N.W. corner
of Franklin Street.
March 27, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail of the same, showing a more comprehensive view of No. 9799, a 6-story loft building, as seen from Leonard Street.
March 27, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
720473f-b.folder: Hudson Street & Harrison Street, Manhattan, NY

720469f-a.text:
Hudson Street, east side, north from Thomas Street. The block of buildings (in the foreground) from Thomas to Worth Streets were raed, and on their site now (1937) stands the 24-story Western Union Building.
October 25, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
720469f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Thomas Street, Manhattan, NY
